Package security

Class HashedPassword

  • java.lang.Object
    • security.HashedPassword
  • public class HashedPassword
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents the binary data of a hashed password. This includes both the salt and the hash itself. This class also has convenience functions for safely verifying a password using the hash. See https://crackstation.net/hashing-security.htm and https://www.baeldung.com/java-password-hashing.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private byte[] hash
      The binary data of the hash itself.
      private byte[] salt
      The binary data of the salt.

    • Field Detail

      • salt

        private byte[] salt
        The binary data of the salt.

      • hash

    • Constructor Detail

      • HashedPassword

        public HashedPassword​(byte[] salt,
                      byte[] hash)
        Create a new HashedPassword object from a pre-made salt and hash. Should only be used for loading a hashed password from the database; use the HashedPassword(password) constructor if you want to create a hash of a new password.
        Parameters:
        salt - A byte array of length SecurityParameters.PASSWORD_SALT_LENGTH_BYTES. MUST be different for every password. MUST be generated by a cryptographically secure random number generator.
        hash - A byte array of length SecurityParameters.PASSWORD_HASH_LENGTH_BYTES. See the implementation of hashedPassword.hashPassword() for the algorithm that must be used to generate this.

      • HashedPassword

        public HashedPassword​(java.lang.String password)
        Create a new HashedPassword by hashing a given plaintext password. This will internally generate a secure random salt. Note that a new random salt is created for every password.
        Parameters:
        password - The plaintext password to hash.

      • HashedPassword

        public HashedPassword​(byte[] salt,
                      java.lang.String password)
        Create a new HashedPassword by hashing a given plaintext password with a given salt. Should only be used for hashing a user-entered password for comparison with the correct hash in the database; use the HashedPassword(password) constructor if you want to create a hash of a new password.
        Parameters:
        salt - The binary data of the salt, loaded from the database.
        password - The plaintext password that the user inputted.

    • Method Detail

      • slowEquals

        private static boolean slowEquals​(byte[] a,
                                  byte[] b)
        Constant-time byte array comparison. Used to compare hashes in such a way that an attacker cannot deduce anything by the amount of time it takes to check a hash. Source: https://crackstation.net/hashing-security.htm
        Parameters:
        a - A byte array to compare with b.
        b - A byte array to compare with a.
        Returns:
        Returns true if they are equal, false if they are not.

      • hashPassword

        private void hashPassword​(byte[] salt,
                          java.lang.String password)
        Given a plaintext password and salt, hash the password using the salt and store the hash in this.hash.
        Parameters:
        salt - The salt to use with the hash. MUST be SecurityParameters.PASSWORD_SALT_LENGTH_BYTES random bytes. MUST be different for every password. MUST be generated by a cryptographically secure random number generator.
        password - The plaintext password to hash.

      • validate

        public boolean validate​(java.lang.String password)
        Take a plaintext password entered by a user and compare it to the hash and salt of this object in order to check if the password is correct.
        Parameters:
        password - The plaintext password inputted by a user trying to log in.
        Returns:
        true if the password was correct. false if the password was wrong.

      • getSalt

        public byte[] getSalt()
        Retrieve the raw binary data of the salt.
        Returns:
        The raw binary data of the salt. Will be SecurityParameters.PASSWORD_SALT_LENGTH_BYTES bytes long.

      • getHash

        public byte[] getHash()
        Retrieve the raw binary data of the hash.
        Returns:
        The raw binary data of the hash. Will be SecurityParameters.PASSWORD_HASH_LENGTH_BYTES bytes long.
